item.title: Beirut blasts may have been caused by seized explosives stored at port
item.description: The two massive explosions that hit Beirut on Tuesday may have been caused by explosive materials confiscated years ago and stored at the city's port, General Security chief Abbas Ibrahim said.

item.title: Lebanon's PM declares 'day of mourning' after Beirut blast
item.description: Georges Kettaneh, the president of the Lebanese Red Cross, referred to "hundreds of wounded" in a statement on Lebanese LBC television, adding: "We are overwhelmed by phone calls."

item.title: US announces clinical trial of antibody treatment for COVID-19
item.description: The medicine is an antibody against the new coronavirus called LY-CoV555, which was identified in the blood sample of a recovered patient by Canada's Abcellera Biologics.

item.title: 20k fraudulent claims being probed in PhilHealth, says Morales
item.description: "Sa ngayon ho may mga 20,000 cases of fraudulent claims na nakabinbin ho sa aming legal sector, sa prosecution, sa arbitration at sa regional offices so tuloy-tuloy ho 'yan," Morales said in a Senate hearing.

item.title: De Lima gives up Senate justice panel seat for Hontiveros
item.description: “Given my current situation and limitations where I cannot vote and wholly participate in Senate sessions and hearings due to my continued unjust detention, I am relinquishing my membership in the Committee on Justice and Human Rights in favor of Sen. Risa Hontiveros,” detained Senator Leila de Lima said.

item.title: Flight cancellations leave Pinoys stranded in airport
item.description: “ Yung pocket money namin, [ang] kasya lang pamasahe papunta dito kasi in-expect na makabiyahe na kami. Wala pala,” passenger Leady Lie Rose said.

item.title: AFP chief s proposal to regulate social media illegal and unconstitutional --Drilon
item.description: The proposal of Armed Forces chief Lieutenant General Gilbert Gapay to regulate social media through the Implementing Rules and Regulations of the Anti-Terrorism Act is “illegal and unconstitutional,” Senate Minority Leader Franklin Drilon said Tuesday.

item.title: Amid talks of bankruptcy, Recto says PhilHealth has P110-B reserve
item.description: Senate President Pro Tempore Ralph Recto on Tuesday said the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) has a P110-billion reserve fund to spend amid the pandemic.

item.title: Two huge explosions rock Beirut
item.description: A huge explosion rocked the Lebanese capital Beirut on Tuesday, shaking buildings, shattering windows and sending a huge plume of smoke into the sky, AFP correspondents said.

item.title: Whistleblower claims overpricing, padding exist in PhilHealth's proposed IT budget
item.description: Hundreds of millions worth of equipment were allegedly inserted in the 2020 budget proposal for PhilHealth's information technology project, a witness revealed in a Senate inquiry on Tuesday.

item.title: Gasoline can cause harm if used as a disinfectant -pulmonologist
item.description: A registered chemist and a pulmonologist warned the public against the use of gasoline as a disinfectant as it may cause harm to the body.

item.title: Eddie Ilarde, former senator and longtime host, passes away at 85
item.description: Former senator and Super Radyo dzBB anchor Eddie Ilarde passed away on Tuesday at the age of 85.

item.title: WHO urges Russia to follow guidelines on virus vaccine
item.description: The World Health Organization on Tuesday urged Russia to follow the established guidelines for producing safe and effective vaccines after Moscow announced plans to start swiftly producing COVID-19 jabs.

item.title: Group warns gov t not to pin hopes on COVID-19 vaccine from China
item.description: Think-tank group Pinoy Aksyon on Tuesday warned the Philippine government not to pin all its hopes on a coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccine from China.

item.title: Seniors still line up for cash aid in Cavite
item.description: “Tignan niyo naman yong sitwasyon namin dito pag umulan. Ang sinisisi namin DSWD bakit kami nilagay dito kung hindi naman kami kayang serbisyuhan? Dapat sa barangay,” one of the residents said.
